title: ANOTHER S RATING COMPLAINT. RIOT FIX THIS.

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
18/3/7 game. I am dying to get lvl 7 on elise but if i play her as a jg should play im punished. Its common for jg players to get hardly any cs in exchange for game carrying plays all throughout the game. RITO, WHY MUST YOUR RATING SYSTEM PUNISH US FOR PLAYING OUR LANE PROPERLY. PLEASE FIX THIS GARBAGE SYSTEM. GETTING 200 CS BY 20mins SHOULD NOT BE THE STANDARD FOR S RATINGS.

Sincerly,

A tilted player of your great game.

replies.body: I know why i didnt get it, but a system that encourages junglers to abandon their most important role, especially champions like lee sin, elise and shaco who all do really good ganks early game makes no sense. I stomped that game because i played elise exactly the way she should be played. Rito is saying dont do that, farm instead.
You should be able to farm between ganks. There's no reason you should only have 74 cs in a 28 minute game. That's horrible.

the point you seem to be missing is that I stomped my game, got dragons, got baron, got turrets, and snowballed my graves and lucian. I won the game with really good efficiency, i didn't have a single minute of down time. Clearly the amount of cs i get is subjective to my ability to win a game. I only farm if im falling behind and need to stay with it. 

So, if i did my absolute best to win a game and succeeded, my question still stands, why do i need to have high CS to be considered good? Of course i know the importance of Cs in other lanes but it makes no sense to focus it in the JG.

Because high CS means more gold and more gold means a larger lead. If you're fed it should be easier to farm since you'll have faster clear and when you gank you should be taxing, provided you don't take the kill.

You are not competing against a "standard", you are competing against how well other people playing the same champion and roles do.
CS does not matter, what matters is _gold_. Good farm just tends to contribute to it heavily.

From what i have seen, the system goes a lot deeper than just basic numbers, it seems to take into consideration teamwork, objectives and good plays.

Well, you are wrong. The graves in the same game, got less GOLD then me, participated in less kills, and died one more time. He got an S+ rating that game. The only difference between me and him, is that he did FAR better in CS.

Graves has different requirements for an S rank, and probably did other things as well.

You cant compare apples and oranges. If you can show proof of someone else playing the same champion and position getting a higher rank with only higher CS, people will care.
You just said Gold was a huge factor and now your saying its not?
no...... you cant compare graves and elise. there completely different champs. gold is a huge factor but each champ has its own expectations for each letter grade.
so you have to do 10 times better than graves with elise to get S lol ;)
What about Wards placed, Objective control, and Map presence?
